intro: Satureja montana var. illyrica, commonly known as Balkan thyme, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and square stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring small, opposite, ovate leaves with a strong, pungent aroma. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, forming dense spikes at the ends of the stems. This variety is valued for its culinary and medicinal uses, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
